posts.post_content: Note: The first ability is *not* a mana ability. You can, for example, cast [Rout](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rout) in response to it and cause the ability to produce no mana at all.

Posted By: SpaceMagic (9/17/2013 7:57:13 PM)
Rating:

This guy is a house. I see him fitting perfectly into the gap left by Bloodbraid Elf in modern jund. I think I'll call him Mr. Tumnus.

@Continue The loyalty-abilities-aren't-mana-abilities clause has been in the comp rules for forever. Interesting that they've only now been able to use it. Cards like Pithing Needle can choke off the first ability too.

@Lord_of_Tresserhorn This is RG we're talking about. Creatures and lands are all they play; it's basically "Put the top seven cards of your library on the battlefield."

Posted By: BloodCrank (9/22/2013 6:11:41 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
At the prerelease, the best thing that has ever happened happened. I get my pack and open it up. I pick up my first booster, tear the wrapper, and I gaze upon the mediocre commons that I saw at first.   
But then it happened.  
I see, near the back of the pack, the border of a planeswalker card. I think, "Hey, sweet! I got a planeswalker! I can certainly use this." So I pull it out of the pack and I read the effects. By this time I am drooling rainbows onto the table. And then I set it down, and I realize   
I HELD IN MY VERY HANDS A FOIL COPY OF XENAGOS, THE REVELER.  
  
It was a good day.
posts.html:
At the prerelease, the best thing that has ever happened happened. I get my pack and open it up. I pick up my first booster, tear the wrapper, and I gaze upon the mediocre commons that I saw at first.
But then it happened.
I see, near the back of the pack, the border of a planeswalker card. I think, "Hey, sweet! I got a planeswalker! I can certainly use this." So I pull it out of the pack and I read the effects. By this time I am drooling rainbows onto the table. And then I set it down, and I realize
I HELD IN MY VERY HANDS A FOIL COPY OF XENAGOS, THE REVELER.

It was a good day.

posts.post_content:
I can see his +1 ability becoming extremely crazy in saproling or other r/g token decks. [Mycoloth](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycoloth) and [Krenko, Mob Boss](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Krenko, Mob Boss) can easily provide those tokens.  
  
Some spells to help him along are [Liege of the Tangle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Liege of the Tangle), [Life and Limb](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Life and Limb), and [Necrogenesis](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Necrogenesis).
posts.html:
I can see his +1 ability becoming extremely crazy in saproling or other r/g token decks. Mycoloth and Krenko, Mob Boss can easily provide those tokens.

Some spells to help him along are Liege of the Tangle, Life and Limb, and Necrogenesis.

Posted By: Gcrudaplaneswalker (9/19/2013 7:53:06 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: He has two good abilities to protect himself with, the ability to make a creature himself or help you cast one, so if you wait a little (maybe in commander?) you might be able to use his ultimate without killing him. Even if it were just seven lands it could still give you enough mana to win the game.  [Doubling season](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name= Doubling season) with any good planeswalker is usually very good, but with Xenagos it's amazing if you can stack it right (remember that ability called scry that they are reprinting in the same set?).
posts.html:
He has two good abilities to protect himself with, the ability to make a creature himself or help you cast one, so if you wait a little (maybe in commander?) you might be able to use his ultimate without killing him. Even if it were just seven lands it could still give you enough mana to win the game. Doubling season with any good planeswalker is usually very good, but with Xenagos it's amazing if you can stack it right (remember that ability called scry that they are reprinting in the same set?).
